history.content:
<md>~~I am pretty sure if a class explicitly says “allowing time-conflicts” it means that if you have a time conflict with the class, this class will have alternative times for final exams. However, it is best if you check up with the prof/ course staff to be sure and contact them about this early on so that they know that you have a time conflict for the final.~~

\-----

I believe the above policy no longer applies @14760 

Gina Garcia, Michael-David Sasson, Cindy Conners at @14760 wrote:

> The policy has gone back to what it was prior to SP21: It is faculty’s discretion whether they will allow time conflicts or not. Please remember that if you DO enroll in a class that allows time conflicts, _<ins>it is YOUR responsibility to make sure you are aware of attendance policies and that faculty is under no obligation to make accommodations</ins>_ for them when it comes to assignment deadlines, midterms, and final times. Again, read the class notes - CS 70 is allowing time conflicts but is NOT going to offer alternate exams (Aside from any potential DSP accommodations.)

However as someone said below, it is pretty standard for 162 to have 3 midterms and no final</md>

<md>~~I am pretty sure if a class explicitly says “allowing time-conflicts” it means that if you have a time conflict with the class, this class will have alternative times for final exams. However, it is best if you check up with the prof/ course staff to be sure and contact them about this early on so that they know that you have a time conflict for the final.~~

\-----

I believe the above policy no longer applies @14760 

Gina Garcia, Michael-David Sasson, Cindy Conners at @14760 wrote:

> The policy has gone back to what it was prior to SP21: It is faculty’s discretion whether they will allow time conflicts or not. Please remember that if you DO enroll in a class that allows time conflicts, _<ins>it is YOUR responsibility to make sure you are aware of attendance policies and that faculty is under no obligation to make accommodations</ins>_ for them when it comes to assignment deadlines, midterms, and final times. Again, read the class notes - CS 70 is allowing time conflicts but is NOT going to offer alternate exams (Aside from any potential DSP accommodations.)</md>

<md>I am pretty sure if a class explicitly says "allowing time-conflicts" it means that if you have a time conflict with the class, this class will have alternative times for final exams. However, it is best if you check up with the prof/ course staff to be sure and contact them about this early on so that they know that you have a time conflict for the final. </md>

I saw that CS 162 this semester is allowing time-conflicts  in Fall 2021 (I happen to be enrolled in EECS C145B that has lecture at the same time). Does this mean that alternate times during which I can take the final exam will be guaranteed as well?
history.subject: CS 162 Allowing Time Conflict
